alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:22PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Strong Cold Front Moving Through Late Sunday and Monday... A strong cold front will push from west to east across the Interior and Alaska Range late Sunday into Monday. This will bring much cooler temperatures, periods of gusty winds, and a wintry mix of rain and snow. Precipitation with the front will initially fall as rain, before switching over to snow Sunday night. Low elevation areas can expect 1-2 inches or less of wet snow to accumulate on grassy or cold surfaces by Monday morning. Above 1500 feet, 2-4 inches or less of wet snow is expected. Periods of rain and snow showers will continue into Monday night. These cooler temperatures will slow the ongoing snowmelt process, but rivers will continue to remain high across the area over the next several days. Break-up is beginning along the Yukon River, and there is the potential for ice jams. For the latest information on the rivers, go to www.weather.gov/aprfc. For the latest forecast, go to www.weather.gov/afg.
